title: FROM THE GROUND UP
subtitle: These recipes begin with a ground meat—beef, chicken, turkey, or pork—and then build into easy, speedy burgers, lasagna cupcakes, meatloaf, and more.

missingData.text: PICK YOUR SALSA With so many different salsa options on store shelves, you can give this meatloaf a different flavor each time you make it. Try chipotle salsa for a deep, smoky flavor. Go green by using salsa verde. Or add a fruity salsa, such as pineapple or peach salsa, for a sweet-savory twist. ■

components.text: 5INGREDIENT RECIPES
FROM THE GROUND UP
These recipes begin with a ground meat—beef, chicken, turkey, or pork—and then build into easy, speedy burgers, lasagna cupcakes, meatloaf, and more.
Mushroom Beef Burgers

HANDS-ON 20 MIN TOTAL 20 MIN SERVES 8
SUBMITTED BY JUANITA S
7 REVIEWS
Serve these burgers on buns with your favorite toppings. We love the classics—lettuce, tomato, onion, mustard, and pickles.

components.html:
3cups finely chopped mushrooms (8 oz.)
1cup finely chopped onion
3cloves garlic, minced
1tsp. Italian seasoning
1tsp. salt
½tsp. black pepper
2lb. 85%-lean ground beef

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Stir together mushrooms, onion, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. With moistened hands, add beef and gently mix just until evenly combined. Shape into eight ½-inch-thick patties.

<lede>2.</lede> Preheat an outdoor grill to medium heat (325°F to 375°F). Lightly oil grate. Grill patties, covered, 5 to 7 minutes per side, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into centers registers 160°F.
armagazine.com/mushroom-beef-burgers
HIDDEN GEM | QUICK
PER BURGER (WITH BUN, WITHOUT TOPPINGS): 402 CAL; 22G FAT (9G SAT); 26G PRO; 25G CARB (2G FIBER, 5G SUGARS); 576MG SODIUM

“This recipe makes burgers that are juicy and very tasty. I cooked them in an air fryer, and they were perfect.”
– CASSIEGAYLE46
Juicy Secret
Adding chopped mushrooms to the beef boosts flavor, sneaks in a veggie, and keeps these burgers big and juicy.
Lasagna Cupcakes

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 40 MIN SERVES 6
SUBMITTED BY KIMBERLEY PIPER
115 REVIEWS
Give these “cupcakes” a pop of extra flavor with chopped fresh basil and crushed red pepper.

components.html:
24wonton wrappers
6oz. ground beef
¼tsp. salt
¼tsp. black pepper
1¼cups grated Parmesan cheese (5 oz.)
1½cups shredded mozzarella cheese (6 oz.)
1cup pasta sauce

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 375°F. Coat twelve 3½-inch muffin cups with cooking spray, then press 1 wonton wrapper into each.
<lede>2.</lede> Cook beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring to break up lumps, until browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper; drain grease.

<lede>3.</lede> Stir together ¾ cup each Parmesan and mozzarella in a bowl. Spoon half the cheese mixture into muffin cups; top with half the beef and half the pasta sauce. Top muffin cups with remaining wonton wrappers, cheese mixture, beef, and sauce. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan and mozzarella.
<lede>4.</lede> Bake until edges are browned, 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool in pan 5 minutes, then run a knife around edges to loosen and remove cupcakes.
armagazine.com/lasagna-cupcakes
PER SERVING (2 CUPCAKES): 355 CAL; 16G FAT (8G SAT); 24G PRO; 26G CARB (1G FIBER, 3G SUGARS); 990MG SODIUM

“I made these vegetarian by using spinach, zucchini, yellow squash, and onions. They tasted even better two days later.”
– CAROL PORTNOY CENNAMO
Alexa-enabled!
Just say, “Alexa, ask Allrecipes for Lasagna Cupcakes.” She’ll guide you through the recipe step-by-step—all hands-free!
Fire-Roasted Corn and Beef Skillet Pie

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 45 MIN SERVES 6
SUBMITTED BY EATANDRUN
NEW RECIPE GO ONLINE TO RATE & REVIEW
Have some pizza seasoning in your spice cabinet? Sprinkle it over the breadsticks before baking.

components.html:
1lb. ground beef
2cups frozen fire-roasted corn
24oz. jar red pasta sauce
¾cup shredded pepper Jack cheese
1(11-oz.) pkg. refrigerated breadsticks

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 400°F. Cook ground beef, stirring and breaking up lumps, in a large cast-iron skillet until browned, about 10 minutes. Stir in corn and pasta sauce. Bring to a boil, then stir in cheese. Unroll breadsticks and loosely weave on top of filling.
<lede>2.</lede> Bake until golden brown and bubbly, 20 to 25 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes.
armagazine.com/fire-roasted-corn-and-beef-skillet-pie
PER SERVING: 435 CAL; 18G FAT (7G SAT); 24G PRO; 43G CARB (4G FIBER, 11G SUGARS); 1,015MG SODIUM
Get More Recipes
Tap here to see 19 fast, family-friendly ground beef dinners. No app download needed!
Spicy Lamb Patties

HANDS-ON 25 MIN TOTAL 25 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY CHEYENNIGANS
72 REVIEWS
Try tucking these spiced patties into pitas along with fresh toppings, such as cucumber, baby spinach, tomato, and/or yogurt.

components.html:
1lb. ground lamb
⅓cup minced green onion
4cloves garlic, minced
1Tbsp. curry powder
1tsp. cumin
¼tsp. crushed red pepper
½tsp. salt
½tsp. black pepper

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat an outdoor or stovetop grill to high (450°F to 650°F). Lightly oil grate.
<lede>2.</lede> Stir all ingredients into a bowl. Form mixture into 4 patties (3¼ inches wide and ¾ inch thick).
<lede>3.</lede> Grill patties to preferred degree of doneness, about 5 minutes per side for medium.
armagazine.com/spicy-lamb-patties
QUICK
PER PATTY: 287 CAL; 22G FAT (9G SAT); 20G PRO; 3G CARB (1G FIBER, 0G SUGARS); 362MG SODIUM

“Remember to check the heat level of the curry powder. There is mild, medium, and hot. If you’re new to curry, start with mild.”
– LAURAELLEN225
Sausage-Egg Muffins

HANDS-ON 20 MIN TOTAL 40 MIN MAKES 12
SUBMITTED BY SMILEYBLAKE
184 REVIEWS
Round out your meal by serving these muffins with salsa and/or fresh fruit.

components.html:
½lb. ground pork sausage
12eggs, beaten
½(4-oz.) can chopped green chile peppers, drained
¾cup chopped onion
1tsp. garlic powder
¼tsp. salt
⅛tsp. black pepper

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease 12 muffin cups.

<lede>2.</lede> Add sausage to a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat; cook, breaking up lumps with a wooden spoon, until evenly browned, about 5 minutes. Drain grease and transfer sausage to a large bowl. Stir in eggs, chiles, onion, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper until well combined. Spoon ¼ cup sausage mixture into each prepared muffin cup.
<lede>3.</lede> Bake until egg has set and a toothpick inserted into centers comes out clean, 15 to 20 minutes.
armagazine.com/sausage-egg-muffins
PER MUFFIN: 132 CAL; 9G FAT (3G SAT); 9G PRO; 2G CARB (0G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 278MG SODIUM

“I added about 2 Tbsp. salsa and a splash of hot sauce instead of the chile peppers. These would probably be even better with some cheese sprinkled on top.”
– BEANIE76

“So much fun! I made these in a mini muffin pan so they were easier to eat and made for a fast breakfast on the run.”
– LAURA
M’s Buffalo Chicken Meatballs

HANDS-ON 25 MIN TOTAL 45 MIN SERVES 10
SUBMITTED BY MMARONIC
51 REVIEWS
For a fresh finish, top these meatballs with chopped parsley or celery leaves.

components.html:
6Tbsp. hot pepper sauce (such as Frank’s RedHot), plus more for serving
¼cup butter
1lb. ground chicken
¾cup dried bread crumbs
1egg, lightly beaten

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 450°F. Grease a large rimmed baking sheet.
<lede>2.</lede> Heat hot sauce and butter in a saucepan over low heat, whisking until butter is melted. Let cool to room temperature.
<lede>3.</lede> Stir together hot sauce mixture, chicken, bread crumbs, and egg in a bowl until well combined. Shape into 1-inch balls; arrange on prepared sheet.

<lede>4.</lede> Bake about 15 minutes, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into centers registers 165°F. Let cool on sheet 5 minutes. Transfer to a platter. Drizzle with additional hot sauce.
armagazine.com/ms-buffalo-chicken-meatballs
PER SERVING (4 MEATBALLS): 145 CAL; 9G FAT (4G SAT); 10G PRO; 6G CARB (0G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 475MG SODIUM

“These were a great way to scratch the itch for chicken wings without having all the fat and calories. I used ground turkey breast and panko bread crumbs.”
– KOOLKITTY

“I tucked a little cheddar inside each meatball. And I added melted butter and hot sauce at the end instead of plain hot sauce. Huge hit!”
– SCARVIN
Healthy Turkey Loaf

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 40 MIN SERVES 6
SUBMITTED BY SUSAN E. MURPHY
518 REVIEWS

components.html:
1lb. ground turkey [Use 93% lean ground turkey, not ground turkey breast, which dries out quickly.]
1egg
½cup salsa, plus more for serving
½cup chopped red and/or yellow bell pepper
½cup dried bread crumbs
¼cup chopped onion (optional)
1tsp. black or lemon pepper
½tsp. salt

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 350°F.
<lede>2.</lede> Combine all ingredients in a large bowl with your hands until well blended. Press mixture into a lightly greased 4x8-inch loaf pan.
<lede>3.</lede> Bake about 25 minutes, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into center registers 165°F. Serve with additional salsa.
armagazine.com/healthy-turkey-loaf
HIDDEN GEM | QUICK | GLUTEN-FREE
PER 4.8-OZ. SERVING: 203 CAL; 9G FAT (2G SAT); 19G PRO; 10G CARB (1G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 481MG SODIUM

“I tried this with some light barbecue sauce poured on the top, and wow—that was good!”
– CINDY LINEBERRY
Pick Your Salsa

With so many different salsa options on store shelves, you can give this meatloaf a different flavor each time you make it. Try chipotle salsa for a deep, smoky flavor. Go green by using salsa verde. Or add a fruity salsa, such as pineapple or peach salsa, for a sweet-savory twist.
